summary: An FBI intake document summarizing a call from a retired law enforcement officer reporting that a former Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office Captain received at least $10,000 from Jeffrey Epstein in 2012, allegedly for doing favors and bending rules. The caller also mentions the Captain's connections to Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, and the subsequent movement of the funds.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the child sex trafficking investigation. Described as paying a police captain and receiving favors.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the police captain did unspecified favors for during the same period as his dealings with Epstein.

connections.description: The document implies association, as the police captain did favors for both during the same period.

events.title: Payment from Epstein to Police Captain
events.description: An unspecified date in 2012 when a former Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office Captain received at least $10,000 from Jeffrey Epstein, shortly before announcing his retirement and plan to run for sheriff.

events.title: FBI Tip Call
events.description: A retired law enforcement officer called the FBI National Threat Operations Center to report the financial transactions and alleged favors between Jeffrey Epstein and a former police captain.

keyFacts: A former Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office Captain received at least $10,000 from Jeffrey Epstein in 2012.
The caller believed the total amount the Captain received from Epstein was closer to $50,000, based on vacations and deposits discovered during divorce proceedings.
The Captain allegedly did favors and 'bent rules' for Epstein, whom he described as 'a nice guy if perverted.'
The same Captain also did unspecified favors for Ghislaine Maxwell during the same period.
The funds from Epstein were reportedly moved through a soap making business set up by a deputy before being forwarded to Epstein.
